Key Arguments: The bill poses a threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians by imposing a state-defined subjective truth.
The bill contradicts Australian and international human rights, potentially restricting public debate and censoring unpopular opinions.
The definitions in the bill are too broad and vague, allowing for potential misuse by those in power.
Notable Quotes: Can I respectfully suggest that state-imposed (subjective) truth poses a threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians, as well as our democracy, society and economy.
The proposed Bill stands in directly Opposition to both Australian and international human rights.
These terms are extremely wide-ranging and ambiguous in nature, making it easy prey for those who wish to exercise excessive power or control over the Australian people.
